sen.j: 秋子内親王（あきこないしんのう、貞建親王妃 秋子内親王、元禄13年1月5日 (旧暦)（1700年2月23日） - 宝暦6年3月29日 (旧暦)（1756年4月28日）は、江戸時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Shushi (Akiko) (also known as Imperial Princess Sadatake, February 23, 1700-April 28, 1756) was an imperial family member during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 秋子内親王の後の括弧の中に再度、秋子内親王とありますが重複するので後者の方は訳出しておりません。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Shushi (Akiko) (the Imperial Princess Shushi, the wife of the Imperial prince Sadatake, February 23, 1700 - April 28, 1756) was an Imperial Family member during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。also known as Imperial Princess Sadatake→the wife of the Imperial Prince Sadatake,imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Shushi (Akiko) (the Imperial Princess Shushi, the wife of the Imperial prince Sadatake, February 23, 1700 - April 28, 1756) was an Imperial Family member during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 東山天皇の第一皇女で、伏見宮貞建親王の妃。
sen.e: She was the first Princess of Emperor Higashiyama and wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadatake.
She was the first princess of the Emperor Higashiyama and the wife of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadatake.
sen.cmt: Princess→princess と修正しました。the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: She was the first princess of the Emperor Higashiyama and the wife of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadatake.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 生母は有栖川宮幸仁親王の王女、中宮幸子女王（承秋門院）。
sen.e: Her real mother was Princess Chugu Sachiko (Joshumonin), a daughter of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yukihito.
Her real mother was the Princess Chugu Sachiko (Joshumonin), a daughter of the Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yukihito.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Her real mother was the Princess Chugu Sachiko (Joshumonin), a daughter of the Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yukihito.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Her childhood name was Himemiya.
Her childhood name was Himemiya.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Her childhood name was Himemiya.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name is Mitsuakiinnomiya.
sen.cmt: 光顕院宮の正式な読み方は確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name is 光顕院宮.
sen.cmt: Mitsuakiinnomiya→光顕院宮 としました。「光顕院宮」の読みは確認が取れておりません。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name is 光顕院宮.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝永4年（1707年）に内親王宣下を受ける。
sen.e: She was given the title of Imperial Princess in 1707.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She was given the imperial edict to become an imperial princess in 1707.
sen.cmt: title of Imperial princess→imperial edict to become an imperial princess と修正しました。
sen.e: She was given the imperial edict to become an imperial princess in 1707.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝永7年（1710年）、従弟（父東山天皇の同母妹福子内親王の子）にあたる貞建親王と婚約し、享保4年（1719年）、20歳で入輿。
sen.e: In 1710, she got engaged to her cousin, Imperial Prince Sadatake (a son of Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was a younger sister of her father, Emperor Higashiyama) and married him in 1719 when she was 20 years old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。 原文に「同母」という言葉がありますが、父親も同じなので訳出しておりません。
sen.e: In 1710, she became engaged to her cousin, the Imperial Prince Sadatake (a son of the Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was a uterine younger sister of her father, the Emperor Higashiyama) and married him in 1719 when she was 20 years old.
sen.cmt: got engaged→became engaged,スペースを修正しました。the を補いました。「同母妹」については原文に忠実に補いました。
sen.e: In 1710, she became engaged to her cousin, the Imperial Prince Sadatake (a son of the Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was a younger sister of her father, the Emperor Higashiyama) and married him in 1719 when she was 20 years old.
sen.cmt: uterine を削除しました（父親も同じ場合は単にsisterでよいと統一リストにあるため）

sen.j: 入輿後は猷子女王、豊子女王の二女を儲けるが男子には恵まれず、家女房の産んだ伏見宮邦忠親王を実子と公称した。
sen.e: After their marriage, she gave birth to two daughters, Princess Michiko and Princess Toyoko, but wasn't blessed with a son, because of which she officially claimed Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kunitada who was born to a Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting) to be her biological child.

After their marriage, she gave birth to two daughters, the Princess Michiko and the Princess Toyoko, but was not blessed with a single son, thus she officially claimed the Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kunitada who was born to a Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting) to be her biological child.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 wasn't→was not,a son→a single son,because of which→thus と修正しました。
sen.e: After their marriage, she gave birth to two daughters, the Princess Michiko and the Princess Toyoko, but was not blessed with a single son, thus she officially claimed the Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kunitada who was born to a Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting) to be her biological child.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、寛保3年（1743年）に二品に叙され、宝暦6年（1756年）、57歳で薨去。
sen.e: Then, she was appointed as Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Princes and Princess' rank) in 1743 and passed away in 1756 at the age of 57.
sen.cmt: 二品の定義は親王の位階で対訳もPrinces' rankとなっているようですが、実際には内親王にも授与されており、また、ここは内親王に対しての記述なので混乱を避けるため、princes and princess's にしてあります。
sen.e: Then, she was conferred Nihon (the second rank of the Imperial Princes' and Princess' rank) in 1743 and passed away in 1756 at the age of 57.
sen.cmt: appointed as→conferred,カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Then, she was conferred Nihon (the second rank of the Imperial Princes' and Princess' rank) in 1743 and passed away in 1756 at the age of 57.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 相国寺（京都市上京区）内の伏見宮墓地に葬られた。
sen.e: She was buried in the grave of the Fushiminomiya family in Shokoku-ji Temple (located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City).
She was buried in the grave of the Fushiminomiya, in the premises of Shokoku-ji Temple (located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: Fushiminomiya family in Shokoku-ji Temple→Fushiminomiya, in the premises of Shokoku-ji Temple と修正しました。
sen.e: She was buried in the grave of the Fushiminomiya, in the premises of Shokoku-ji Temple (located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
